lead_paragraph: Escapees from the Iraqi city of Mosul describe the Islamic State’s extreme dress code, which made showing so much as an eyebrow an offense punishable by the whip.

headline.print_headline: Under ISIS Dress Code, Even Women’s Eyes Were Soon Erased
headline.main: For Women Under ISIS, a Tyranny of Dress Code and Punishment

snippet: Escapees from the Iraqi city of Mosul describe the Islamic State’s extreme dress code, which made showing so much as an eyebrow an offense punishable by the whip....
abstract: Islamic State, after overtaking Mosul, Iraq, in June 2014, imposed strict dress code for women requiring that they wear loose-fitting gown, gloves, face covering known as niqab and, eventually, eye covering; women in Mosul, saying increasing number of informants are watching them, describe inability to carry out even basic tasks due to black film over eyes, and speak of severe punishments that have been doled out.
